SENT.plain: We measured the cerebrospinal fluid (CSF) levels of beta-endorphin in 7 Japanese patients with Joseph disease and compared them with control values
The 7 patients included 4 with type I and 3 with type II disease; their mean age was 45.7 +/- 12.09 years
Diseased controls were matched in age to the patients studied
In these patients, CSF beta-endorphin level was significantly lower than in the controls (40% of normal values)
An alteration in CSF beta-endorphin level may explain some of the neurological impairment found in Joseph disease
